text: In the description. Dragon Ball Z: Super Butode.
author: Retrauk

text:
The scene where Imperfect Cell reveals himself is, to this day, one of the freakiest things I have ever seen as a kid. It was all built up to that point, with the cities empty and only people's clothes lying around, the mysterious time machine with the alien husk they find and finally that fat guy begging for his life... That poor bastard. And also poor Lucas, who stood still horrified staring at his TV. 







So why the heck is this song so cheery?!
author: Lucas

text: Imperfect theme for an imperfect cell
author: Kakashi Hatake

text: This sounds like a fun day at the beach, not a horrifying life-sucking android.
author: Space Lizard

text:
"how...HOW MANY PEOPLE!!?"

"...enough..."

That line in the scene in the thumbnail on the abridged dub is really more striking than the official one
author: mesamus

text: Mainly nostalgia with this one as it was my first DBZ game and I was huge DBZ fan (still am!). Super Butoden 2 was a much improved sequel, but it still provided me with some good entertainment trying to pull off Kamehamehas. According to the DBZ wiki, this remains the best selling DB game in Japan to date with 1.45 million units sold. I'm surprised!
author: SupraDarky

text: +SupraDarky what do you think of super?

text: +SupraDarky So which are you favorite 3 DB characters? ;)
author: Fak Yuh Googel

text: +SupraDarky Ah, such nostalgia! More of this please! :D Or even more DBZ games in general :P
author: ralphyman

text: +MikeHoopla To be honest, I'm just happy to watch new episodes in its universe. Seeing the cast of characters/villains again feels good. The main arcs are hit and miss so far (I was disappointed with Golden Frieza), but I absolutely love the "slice of life" episodes, surprisingly enough.
author: SupraDarky

text: Not sure if you had known this, but pre-ordering Extreme Butoden on 3DS netted people a free download of Super Butoden 2 for 3DS. It's completely untranslated, but still cool.
